MAG: Magnetic VFM vector and ASM scalar data (1Hz)
EFI: Plasma data from the Langmuir probe including electron temperature and plasma density (2Hz)
EFI_IDM: Ion drift, density and effective mass data
EFI_TCT: Thermal ion imager cross track flow data (2Hz)
FAC: Field aligned current (single and dual S/C) and auroral oval boundaries determined from FAC
Single S/C FAC example VRE notebook
Dual S/C FAC example VRE notebook
AEJ_LPL: Auroral electrojets calculated by the Line Current method
AEJ_LPS: Auroral electrojets calculated by the Spherical Elementary Current Systems method

B_NEC_resAC.name: Magnetic field vector A - C difference

Flags_F.name: Flags characterizing the magnetic field intensity measurement (F)

flags: Set when ASM is running in vector mode.
Set for outlier detected, gap, or not enough ASM frequency calibration data for filtering.
Set when at least one of 4 nearest ASM samples is suspicious.
Set for loss of magnetic field lock or telemetry within 8 seconds after ASM restart.
Set for discrepancy between ASM and VFM measurements – at least one of the 4 nearest ASM samples differ from VFM measurements.
Set for gap in 4 nearest ASM samples.
Set for VFM instrument turned off (no stray field corrections).
Set for not enough ASM samples to generate F.

Flags_B.name: Flags characterizing the magnetic field vector measurement (B_VFM, B_NEC)

flags: Set when ASM instrument is turned off.
Set for outlier detected, gap, or not enough VFM temperature data for filtering.
Set for more than 5 suspiciuos VFM samples in 2 seconds surrounding record time.
Set for discrepancy between ASM and VFM measurements.
Set for in VFM samples in surrounding 2 seconds.
Set for not enough VFM samples to generate B_VFM and B_NEC.

B_error.name: Error estimates on magnetic field, VFM frame

V_i_raw.name: Ion along-track drift without high-latitude detrending

Phi_sc.name: Spacecraft floating potential with respect to plasma potential far from satellite

Viy.name: Cross-track horizontal ion drift (horizontal TII)
Viy.description: Cross-track horizontal ion drift from horizontal TII sensor in satellite-track coordinates.

Viz.name: Cross-track vertical ion drift (vertival TII)
Viz.description: Cross-track vertical ion drift from vertical TII sensor in satellite-track coordinates.

Viyz.name: Cross-track ion drift vector (combined horizontal and vertical TII)
Viyz.description: Ion drift from vertical TII sensor in satellite-track coordinates.

Vixy.description: Ion drift from horizontal TII sensor in satellite-track coordinates.

Vixz.name: Ion drift vector (vertical TII)

Eh.name: Electric field vector (horizontal TII)
Eh.description: Electric field vector in satellite-track coordinates, derived from -VxB with along-track ion drift from horizontal sensor.

Ev.name: Electric field vector (vertical TII)
Ev.description: Electric field vector in satellite-track coordinates, derived from -VxB with along-track ion drift from vertical sensor.

Quality_flags.name: Bitwise flag for each velocity component
Quality_flags.description: Bitwise flag for each velocity component, where a value of 1 for a particular component signifies that calibration was successful, and that the baseline 1-sigma noise level is less than or equal to 100 m/s at 2 Hz. Electric field quality can be assessed from these flags according to -vxB.

flags: Set when a background linear model offset was not removed
Set for an incomplete fit region (no background subtraction performed)
Set for a fit error reported by the GNU Scientific Library
Set when the mid-latitude median absolute deviation threshold was exceeded
Set for the 16 Hz ion flow magnitude exceeding 8 km/s
Set when a background linear model offset was not removed
Set for an incomplete fit region (no background subtraction performed)
Set for a fit error reported by the GNU Scientific Library
Set when the mid-latitude median absolute deviation threshold was exceeded
Set for the 16 Hz ion flow magnitude exceeding 8 km/s

Set for the 16 Hz ion flow magnitude exceeding 8 km/s
